metadata.name: Geode #190
metadata.description:
A single seed shape is chosen from 13, and placed onto the plane. At every step, a copy of this seed is laid edge-to-edge adjacent to an existing shape, without causing any overlaps. This copy is colored based on the edge it shares with the existing shape. The process continues until the animation completes.

New shapes are placed closest to a moving target. In some mints, this target is slow moving, causing new shapes to expand radially from the seed. In other mints, this target races around, causing new shapes to chase it. 

Each of the 13 shapes forms different patterns under different circumstances. Not all patterns will be explored.

Controls:
  - SPACE: Pause/unpause the animation.
  - ENTER: Skip the animation.
  - R: Restart the animation.

URL Params:
  - "preview=1": Skip the animation.
  - "flex=1": Adapt the boundaries to the size of the window.
  - “slow=1”: Draw only one shape per frame.

Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

Our skies in the next 30 years as temperatures are intensifying and we experience, in the present, unprecedent heat waves. 

Inspired in polaroid images. Each output represents an image, a collectible and a document of perpetual suns. 

Each image showcases a random date and time in the next 30 years.

Oftentimes we will see how the suns try to breach the borders of the polaroid. They seldom manage to completely invade the frame.

Press “s” to save a png image.
Press “h” to save a high resolution: 5500 x 3660 or 3660 x 5500 png frame.

metadata.name: Dune & Moon #55
metadata.description: The dune and the moon

metadata.name: CHIP #92
metadata.description:
A CHIP is being constructed by using two brushes that are painting on the board through deterministic noise, and then turned squared and pixelated and blended into each other, with colours selected from 21 different colour schemes. How many iterations, and the speed and size of the added parts determines the final composition. 

You can stop the iterations by pressing S, and download the current composition by hitting D, and restart/reload the iterations by pressing R.

Notes
The thumbnail generation takes a while and the render/iterations in non-GPU browser can be quite slow. Chrome/Firefox recommended.

metadata.name: Connection #3
metadata.description:
A connection refers to a relationship or link between two or more things, which can be either physical, such as a bridge connecting two land masses, or abstract, such as the connection between two people who have formed a friendship, or the connection between two related events, which is often characterized by some form of communication or relationship.

Usage
- Tap on the shape in the center to create more shapes.
- Tap on a moving shape to grab it, it can be used to push other shapes.
- To release a shape, quickly move the mouse while simultaneously clicking the mouse.

metadata.name: Levitation #105
metadata.description:
Abstract structures floating in space. 

——————

Levitation continues my exploration of Suprematism and Geometric Abstraction. It contains my developments and ideas for the past half a year.
Starting as mostly inspired by Kleine Welten (Small Worlds) series by Wassily Kandinsky, the collection evolved more into Suprematic compositions.

——————

To change the size of an image, open it in live view and add ‘&size=[size (6200 max.)]’ to the end of the URL.

Controls:
[Arrow Up / Down] — increase / decrease animation speed.
[R] — skip the animation.
[C] — switch between clean and grainy versions.
[S] — save the image.

Created using p5.js and GLSL.
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0.

——————

hrunz. — Nov. 2022.

metadata.name: Continuum #252
metadata.description:
This project is the culmination of many generative art experiments I have run throughout 2022. It relies heavily on the random walks through color and space techniques I have been working with, but also introduces other elements related to 2D and 3D rotation, framing and grains.

Continuum began as an abstract composition made up of a set of interacting elements against a background. This is still true. However, in my own mind, I have come to consider many Continuum pieces as peculiar, stylized observations of massive futuristic spacial, or quantum, constructions. Maybe even involving a wormhole through the fabric of space-time for some civilization well past 1 on the Kardashev scale. At the center is an erratic crystalline form, which is fed by power trains, and all around is a massive multicolored rotating containment structure.

Aside from the standard, inverse, threshold and washed types, the most defining trait of each composition is the “Back Style” which relates to a point of construction, activity or deconstruction of these structures. This is further refined by the panel style, the panel density and the rotation level. The other traits largely relate to color variability and aesthetics. 

This work has been coded using p5.js, and half of all royalties from the primary, and secondary, sales are assigned to the processing foundation.

Press s to download a 2400x2400 pixel image.

This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

metadata.name: Ethereal Microcosm #252
metadata.description:
An exploration of algorithmic organisms in a contained environment.

This piece is about the simulation of microscopic patterns using a high number of even tinier agents all following the same rules. Different species evolve and interact together, resulting in stabilizing patterns out of their parametric configurations. A form of artificial life.

This work is based on the paper "Characteristics of pattern formation and evolution in approximations of physarum transport networks", written by Jeff Jones and popularized in the artistic field by Sage Jenson. Some features were added to increase the visual and behavioral complexity of the system. Agents are divided into different species, with their own set of rules and interacting with their own substrate. Substrates also interact with each other and agents will mutate in contact of some of them.

NFT License
Runs properly on Chrome 97.0.4692.99
GPU intensive

Press P to pause (double tab touch devices)
Press

metadata.name: MOUNTAINS #185
metadata.description:
"MOUNTAINS" is a work that belongs to the "FLUX Series", which utilizes the same techniques and processes as the previous work "FLUX". The shape in this piece is created by placing elements using noise and then performing recursive pixel operations on these elements.

The inspiration behind this work came from my continued sketches and studies of Flow Field, which led me to discover an expression of objects that seemed to be corroding. I believed that by applying this technique, I could create a realistic and vivid sculpture from a geometric shape.In this work, this corrosion treatment is applied to a geometric triangular shape of overlapping rectangles to form a realistic and dynamic mountain landscape.
It was as if geometric figures like Plato's "ideas" were materialized in the real world.

Additionally,  I was also inspired by the mountain views from my hometown at New Year's and by the manga background paintings of Yoshiharu Tsuge, who specializes in depicting villages with old hot springs.

It is possible to get a 5760 x 3240 px png file by right click save.

Please feel free to contact me if you have any inquiries.

Artwork by hasaqui, @hasaqui.
Made with p5js
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Chrysalis #244
metadata.description: Interact: click & drag, zoom, press 'g'.

metadata.name: Chrysalis #292
metadata.description: Interact: click & drag, zoom, press 'g'.

metadata.name: Para Metric #2 #24
metadata.description: As with the previous collection, this collection is based on an elementary mathematical principle; a parametric equation. Despite the simplicity of the principle, the results are simply stunning. All kinds of intricate shapes and patterns are formed by drawing random dots a parametric equation solely based on sines and cosines. This time, the parametric equations intersect, which results in a higher degree of complexity. I hope you enjoy the pieces!

metadata.name: Chrysalis #487
metadata.description: Interact: click & drag, zoom, press 'g'.

metadata.name: Secret Stairways #37
metadata.description:
"Secret Stairways" is a project that uses principles of Cellular Automaton to construct buildings that can remember a castle, villages...Wich I have many inspirations in architecture and buildings from the place I live (Minas Gerais).

This project use only points() and shadows(the colors) in its rendering, the algorithm randoms sorts to 5000-9000 points for each iteration. So rendering time can take a while depending of ammount of points the algo has sorted. 
Can take from 30 seconds to 1 minute to full render, after it the textures are instantly applied.

// 5 Shadow Colors
// 5 Background Colors


Works properly on Chromium based Web Browsers.






-Press "S" to save a .png file of the artwork


This is a project in p5.js



Omar Lobato,
08/03/2022.

objkt.name: In a Moment, a Thousand Years #14

metadata.name: In a Moment, a Thousand Years #14
metadata.description:
Fragmented time and fractured memories.

=========

Controls:

[1] set resolution to 716 x 1024px (default)
[2] set resolution to 1433 x 2048px
[3] set resolution to 2455 x 3508px (approx. the size of A4 paper)
[4] set resolution to 3472 x 4961px (approx. the size of A3 paper)
[5] set resolution to 4911 x 7016px (approx. the size of A2 paper)

[0] set resolution to current window size

[c] capture a screenshot at rendered resolution

*The higher resolution settings (3-5) can slow down your device, especially on a low-end laptop without a dedicated GPU. Use it only to render and download a hi-res output for printing. For screen viewing [1] or [2] is recommended.



Made with cables.gl, a node-based webgl environment

XALTED 2022

issuer.name: In a Moment, a Thousand Years

metadata.name: Boketto #22
metadata.description:
'Boketto' is the act of gazing vacantly into the distance without a thought.

On the process of making this collection, i explored interfering patterns in order to give an abstract and more painted look on the canvas.

--Features--

Palette : 14 different color palettes
Scheme : 11 different schemes
Step : 7 different steps
Rotation : 9 types (each type has more than 30 different outcomes)

Press "s" to save a 1600x2000 PNG

High resolution outputs will be uploaded on my (under contruction) site soon 

Made with p5js & ❤️

Gtsiliakos_art, October 2022

metadata.name: SoulSea #239
metadata.description:
The Soul Sea

You look down and find that the ocean in your heart is a sine wave. 
The tide gently laps onto the shore.

The soul is the sea. You are the land. 
There are waves on the shore, and the waves are slices.

Gazing at the slices, you feel the coldness of the Arctic Ocean, the permafrost of the Antarctic Sea, the deep darkness of the bottomless sea.

Stay silent, hear the sound of the waves lapping at the innumerable shores far away.
Feel the soul of the digital ocean.

Interactivities:
> Key P: Pause
> Key S: Save
> Press and move mouseX: wave moves slower / faster

Che-Yu Wu

metadata.name: Mandelroid #354
metadata.description:
The Mandelbrot set is a mathematical object that is generated by a simple formula, and it exhibits some interesting visual patterns that are reminiscent of those found in nature, such as the self-similarity of branching structures, the repetition of small-scale patterns on larger scales, and the presence of chaotic behavior.

The beauty of Polaroid film lies in its ability to capture and preserve a moment in space and time in a unique and tangible way.

This work combines two things that are incongruent with each other and brings them together to create a digital memory that serves as a reminder that complexity can be found even in the simplest things, that art is intrinsic to nature itself.

• press '1' to scale the photo to 1024x1024 pixels (the default output)
• press '2' to scale the photo to 2048x2048 pixels (Warning: can be slow!)
• press '3' to scale the photo to 4096x4096 pixels (Warning: can be very slow!)
• press 'd' to save the Mandelbrot Set
• press 's' to save the Polaroid film

Done with p5.js
Simone "OuterSilent" Ferrari | @outertales | December 2022
